member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm
member.summary:
Static implementation of the Luhn algorithm (Modulus-10), as mandated by ISO/IEC 7812-1:2017 §6 for PAN check-digit computation.
The algorithm detects single-digit transcription errors and most digit-transposition errors. It is not a cryptographic security mechanism — it guards against accidental mis-entry, not intentional fraud.
خوارزمية Luhn (Modulus-10) — المُعتمَدة وفق ISO/IEC 7812-1:2017 للتحقق من رقم التحقق (Check Digit) في أرقام البطاقات البنكية.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a complete PAN (including its check digit) against the Luhn algorithm.
member.param: Full card number string. Spaces and dashes are stripped automatically. Leading / trailing whitespace is ignored.
member.returns: true if the number passes the Luhn check; false otherwise. Returns false for null, empty, or non-numeric input.

example.code: bool ok = LuhnAlgorithm.IsValid("4111 1111 1111 1111"); // true bool bad = LuhnAlgorithm.IsValid("4111111111111112"); // false

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm.CalculateChecksum(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the Luhn checksum of a digit string (including the check digit). A valid PAN returns 0.
member.returns: Checksum value (0–9). A result of 0 indicates a valid PAN.
member.exception: Thrown if is null, empty, or contains non-digit characters.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm.CalculateCheckDigit(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the Luhn check digit for a partial PAN (all digits except the last one). Append the returned value to to produce a Luhn-valid PAN.
member.param: The PAN without its final check digit — digits only (spaces/dashes stripped automatically).
member.returns: Check digit in the range 0–9.
member.exception: Thrown when is null, empty, or contains non-digit characters.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm.GenerateTestCardNumber(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Generates a Luhn-valid test card number for a given IIN/BIN prefix.
⚠ For testing and development only. The generated number is mathematically valid but does not correspond to any real account.
member.param: IIN / BIN prefix (6 or 8 digits). Must be digit-only. Example: "507803" (Meeza NBE), "411111" (Visa test prefix).
Desired total PAN length including the check digit (default: 16). Must be greater than the length of + 1.
member.returns: A Luhn-valid PAN string of length .

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnAlgorithm.GetDetailedSteps(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a detailed, step-by-step breakdown of the Luhn computation for educational or debugging purposes.
member.param: Full PAN to inspect. Spaces and dashes are stripped automatically.
member.returns: A containing every processing step, the total sum, the check digit, and the overall validity.

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep
member.summary: Represents the processing of a single digit during the Luhn algorithm traversal.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep.Position
member.summary: Zero-based position of this digit within the PAN string (left-to-right).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep.OriginalDigit
member.summary: Original digit value before any Luhn processing (0–9).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep.Doubled
member.summary: true if this digit was doubled as part of the Luhn algorithm.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep.ProcessedValue
member.summary: Processed digit value after optional doubling and carry subtraction (i.e. if doubled result > 9, subtract 9).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStep.RunningSum
member.summary: Cumulative sum of all processed digits from the rightmost position up to and including this step.

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult
member.summary: Encapsulates the complete, step-by-step result of a Luhn algorithm computation. Returned by .

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult.CardNumber
member.summary: The sanitised PAN that was analysed.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult.TotalSum
member.summary: Final sum of all processed digits.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult.IsValid
member.summary: true if mod 10 equals 0 (Luhn-valid PAN).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult.CheckDigit
member.summary: The check digit (last digit of the PAN). −1 if input was empty.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Algorithm.LuhnStepResult.Steps
member.summary: Ordered list of per-digit processing steps (left-to-right order).

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Extensions.BankCardExtensions
member.summary:
Provides fluent extension methods on for quick, one-liner card validation and inspection without instantiating a directly.
Thread safety: A ThreadLocal<BankCardValidator> is used internally so that each thread gets its own validator instance, avoiding contention on shared state.
يوفر extension methods على لإجراء التحقق والتحليل السريع دون الحاجة لإنشاء بشكل صريح. آمن للخيوط المتعددة باستخدام ThreadLocal.

Display language for bilingual alias properties. Defaults to English.

member.summary: Returns the last four digits of the PAN (safe to display per PCI-DSS). Returns the original string if it is 4 characters or fewer.

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Info.BankCardInfo
member.summary:
Immutable-by-convention result object returned by and .
Every string field that has a bilingual equivalent is stored in both languages. The primary (un-suffixed) property reflects whichever was supplied to the validator; the secondary copy always keeps the opposite language. This means callers can switch display language at any time without re-analysing the card.
نموذج النتيجة الكامل لتحليل بطاقة بنكية واحدة. كل حقل ثنائي اللغة متوفر بالإنجليزية والعربية في آنٍ واحد. الحقل الأساسي (بدون لاحقة) يعكس اللغة المختارة عند الاستدعاء.

member.summary:
Static BIN / IIN database containing:
Egyptian bank issuers (Meeza, Visa EG, Mastercard EG) with full metadata.
Global network prefix ranges for automatic scheme detection.
Data is accurate as of February 2025. For production use, consider supplementing with a commercial BIN database (e.g. Mastercard BIN API, Stripe, or Adyen).

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Logger.IBankCardLogger
member.summary:
Optional logging abstraction for . Implement this interface and pass an instance to the validator constructor to receive structured audit events for every card analysis.
This design keeps the library free of any hard dependency on Microsoft.Extensions.Logging, Serilog, NLog, or any other framework. You can bridge to any logging backend in your own implementation.
واجهة التسجيل الاختيارية — نفِّذها وأرسلها للـ BankCardValidator لتلقّي أحداث التدقيق لكل عملية تحليل بطاقة.

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Validator.BankCardValidator
member.summary:
Thread-safe validator and analyser for payment card numbers (PANs).
Key capabilities:
Luhn (Modulus-10) check digit validation per ISO/IEC 7812-1:2017 §6.
IIN/BIN detection for Egyptian banks (Meeza, Visa EG, Mastercard EG) and all major global schemes.
Full bilingual output (English + Arabic) with caller-selectable display language via .
Optional expiry, CVV, and cardholder-name validation via .
Built-in LRU-style result cache to avoid redundant computation for repeated inputs.
Optional structured logging via .
مُحلِّل ومُحقِّق شامل لأرقام البطاقات البنكية — آمن للخيوط المتعددة. يدعم اللغتين العربية والإنجليزية مع كاش داخلي وتسجيل اختياري.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Validator.BankCardValidator.#ctor(NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Enums.DisplayLanguage,NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Logger.IBankCardLogger)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance.
member.param: Default display language for bilingual alias properties on (e.g. ). Defaults to . Can be overridden per-call via the language parameter on each Analyze method.
Optional logger. Pass new ConsoleBankCardLogger() during development. When null, the silent is used.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Validator.BankCardValidator.Analyze(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{NumericValidation.EG.Models.BankCard.Enums.DisplayLanguage})
member.summary: Analyses a payment card number (PAN) and returns a fully populated .
member.param: The PAN to analyse. Spaces and dashes are stripped automatically. Accepts null — returns an invalid result with .
When true and the detected issuer supports Tokenization, a deterministic test token is generated and stored in . Never use the generated token in production payment flows.
When true, a step-by-step Luhn computation breakdown is attached to . Useful for educational tooling and debugging.
Override the instance-level display language for this call only. When null the instance default () is used.
member.returns: A instance. is the primary pass/fail indicator.

member.summary: Performs a full card validation including optional expiry date, CVV, and cardholder name checks. Wraps and adds supplementary field validation.
member.param: Optional expiry date string. Accepted formats: "MM/YY", "MM/YYYY", "MMYY", "MMYYYY", "MM YY", "MM YYYY", "MM-YY", "MM-YYYY" (spaces and separators are stripped).
Optional CVV / CVC / CID value (digit string).
Optional cardholder name (Latin letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes; 2–26 chars).
member.returns: A where is true only if the PAN itself, plus all supplied optional fields, all pass validation.

member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo
member.summary: Contains comprehensive information about a phone number validation result. This class represents the parsed and validated data for Egyptian phone numbers.
member.remarks: The PhoneNumberInfo class is the primary data structure returned by phone number validation operations. It contains both the original input and parsed components with validation status and carrier information.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.OriginalNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the original input phone number as provided by the user.
member.value: The raw phone number string exactly as entered, including any formatting, spaces, or special characters.
member.remarks: This property preserves the exact user input for audit trails and debugging purposes. It is not modified during the validation process.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.CleanedNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the phone number after cleaning and normalization.
member.value: The phone number with all non-digit characters removed, but before any country code or prefix transformations.
member.remarks: This intermediate representation is used internally during validation and contains only numeric digits.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.Number
member.summary: Gets or sets the final formatted phone number in local format.
member.value: The complete phone number in standard Egyptian format (e.g., "01234567890"). This is the canonical representation used for storage and display.
member.remarks: The number includes the carrier prefix and subscriber number in a consistent format without international dialing codes.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the carrier prefix (first 4 digits of the phone number).
member.value: A 4-digit string representing the carrier-specific prefix that identifies the mobile network operator (e.g., "0123" for Vodafone Egypt).
member.remarks: The prefix determines both the carrier and service type. Each prefix is assigned to specific mobile operators by the National Telecom Regulatory Authority (NTRA).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.Carrier
member.summary: Gets or sets the mobile network carrier name.
member.value: The name of the telecom operator providing service for this number (e.g., "Vodafone Egypt", "Orange Egypt", "Etisalat Misr", "We").
member.remarks: Carrier information is derived from the prefix using NTRA's official numbering plan for Egypt.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.ServiceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of telecommunication service.
member.value: A string describing the service category: "Mobile" for regular mobile numbers or "Value Added Service" for special service numbers.
member.remarks: Service type classification helps differentiate between standard mobile services and premium/specialized services with different billing rates and regulations.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.IsValid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the phone number is valid.
member.value: true if the phone number passes all validation checks including format, length, and prefix verification; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property represents the overall validation status. When false, the property contains details about the validation failure.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message describing validation failure.
member.value: A descriptive error message in Arabic and English explaining why the phone number failed validation. Empty string when validation succeeds.
member.remarks: Error messages are designed to be user-friendly and help identify specific issues with the input phone number.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the phone number validation result.
member.returns: A formatted string containing key validation information including the phone number, validation status, carrier, and any error message.
member.remarks: This method is primarily used for debugging and logging purposes. The format is: "Number: {Number}, IsValid: {IsValid}, Carrier: {Carrier}, ErrorMessage: {ErrorMessage}"

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
member.param: The object to compare with the current object.
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Two PhoneNumberInfo objects are considered equal if their properties are equal, regardless of other properties.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as the default hash function.
member.returns: A hash code for the current object.
member.remarks: The hash code is based on the property.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the current PhoneNumberInfo object.
member.returns: A new PhoneNumberInfo object with the same property values.
member.remarks: This method creates a completely independent copy that can be modified without affecting the original object.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.ToInternationalFormat
member.summary: Formats the phone number for international dialing.
member.returns: The phone number in international format with Egypt country code (+20).
member.remarks: This method assumes the number is already in valid Egyptian format. It prepends the international access code and Egypt country code.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.ToDisplayFormat
member.summary: Formats the phone number for display with standard spacing.
member.returns: The phone number formatted with spaces for readability.
member.remarks: The standard Egyptian format is: 0XXX XXX XXXX (e.g., "0123 456 7890")

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.Info.PhoneNumberInfo.IsComplete
member.summary: Validates that all required properties are populated for a valid phone number.
member.returns: true if the object represents a complete valid phone number; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs additional consistency checks beyond the basic IsValid flag, ensuring that all derived properties are correctly populated.
